document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the genus Glaucocharis Meyrick (Lepidoptera, Crambidae, Crambinae) from China, with descriptions of nine new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the genus Glaucocharis Meyrick (Lepidoptera, Crambidae, Crambinae) from China, with descriptions of nine new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Glaucocharis
species based on female genitalia

paragraph.keyLead: 2 . Antrum anteriorly with sclerotized protuberance............................................................ 3
- Antrum anteriorly without sclerotized protuberance......................................................... 4

3 . Anterior protuberance of antrum thumb-shaped (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 125 )...........................
G. mutuurella

- Anterior protuberance of antrum rounded (
Fig. 30
).................................................
G. hastatella

4 . Ductus bursae nearly as long as corpus bursae (
Fig. 25
).......................................
G. scrotiformis
sp. n.

6 . Ductus bursae curved in N shape (
Fig. 24
)..................................................
G. biconvexa
sp. n.

- Ductus bursae nearly straight (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 126 )...........................................
G. infundella

9 . Antrum with one gyroidally sclerotized line (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 95 ).................................
G. minutalis

- Antrum with two gyroidally sclerotized lines (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 99 ).................................
G. taeniata

12 . Lamellae antervaginalis double and aliform (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 110 ).................................
G. alatella

- Lamellae antervaginalis single and linear (
Bleszynski 1965
: Pl. 87 ,
Fig. 8
;
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 92 )......... G. c o p e r n i c i

14 . Antrum straight, about twice as thick as middle part of ductus bursae; ductus seminalis arising from middle part of ductus bursae (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 113 )............................................................
G. himalayana

- Antrum curved, as thick as middle part of ductus bursae; ductus seminalis arising from anterior one fourth of ductus bursae (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 94 )....................................................................
G. melistoma

15 . Antrum curved anteriorly; ductus seminalis arising from anterior part of ductus bursae (
Wang et al. , 1988
: Figs 114–116 )...........................................................................................
G. rectifascialis

- Antrum straight; ductus seminalis arising from posterior margin of corpus bursae (
Wang et al. 1988
: Figs 108, 109 )...............................................................................................
G. subalbilinealis
18 . Ductus seminalis arising from middle part of ductus bursae.................................................. 19
- Ductus seminalis arising from anterior part of ductus bursae................................................. 21

19 . Antrum funnel-shaped (
Bleszynski 1965 : Pl. 86 ,
Fig. 6
)...........................................
G. rosannoides

20 . Posterior part of corpus bursae tapering and much narrower than anterior part (
Fig. 29
)...............
G. huanggangensis

- Posterior part of corpus bursae as wide as anterior part (
Bleszynski 1965 : Pl. 86 ,
Fig. 3
)...................
G. exsectella

21 . Ductus bursae conspicuously convex medially at lateral margin (
Fig. 27
)................................
G. incisella

22 . Ostium bursae about three times as thick as medial part of ductus bursae, ductus busae funnel-shaped (
Fig. 22
).................................................................................................
G. siciformis
sp. n.
- Ostium bursae nearly as thick as medial part of ductus bursae, ductus busae tubular............................... 23

23 . Ductus bursae curved as C-shaped posteriorly (
Fig. 21
)......................................
G. paulispinata
sp. n.

- Ductus bursae nearly straight posteriorly (
Fig. 32
)................................................
G. longqiensis

24 . Antrum with a sclerotized plate in middle (
Fig. 33
)...............................................
G. parmulella

- Antrum without sclerotized plate (
Bleszynski 1965 : Pl. 86 ,
Fig. 4
).......................................
G. electra

26 . Antrum with anterior part thinner than posterior part (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 129 )........................
G. spinulella
- Antrum with anterior part thicker than posterior part....................................................... 27

27 . Posterior margin of antrum concave (
Bleszynski 1965 : Pl. 87 ,
Fig. 9
)................................
G. moriokensis

- Posterior margin of antrum straight (
Fig. 23
).................................................
G. tridentata
sp. n.
28 . Ostium bursae about two to three times as thick as medial part of ductus bursae.................................. 29
- Ostium bursae about about six times as thick as medial part of ductus bursae.................................... 30

29 . Ductus seminalis arising from anterior margin of antrum (
Fig. 26
)..................................
G. setosa
sp. n.

- Ductus seminalis arising from anterior part of ductus bursae (
Bleszynski 1965 : Pl. 86 ,
Fig. 5
)................. G. ro s a n n a

30 . Antrum densely covered with tiny spines at posterior part (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 112 ).....................
G. baculella

32 . Antrum convex anterolaterally (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 128 ).........................................
G. ochronella

34 . Posterior margin of antrum straight (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 117 )......................................
G. chelatella

35 . Posterior margin of antrum V-shaped (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 102 )...................................
G. rhamphella

36 . Anterior part of antrum circularly swollen (
Bleszynski 1965 : Pl. 87 ,
Fig. 14
; Wang et al. : Figs 106, 107
).....
G. tripunctata

- Anterior part of antrum not swollen (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 105 )......................................
G. spiculella

38 . Anterior margin of antrum with a thumb-shaped protuberance (
Fig. 31
)................................
G. omeishani
- Anterior margin of antrum with an ovate protuberance...................................................... 39

39 . Ovate protuberance twice as thick as antrum (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 127 )..............................
G. forcipella

- Ovate protuberance a bit thicker than antrum (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 98 ).................................
G. reniella

41 . Ductus bursae curved anteriorly; corpus bursae with two rounded signa (
Fig. 20
).......................
G. brevis
sp. n.

- Ductus bursae straight anteriorly; corpus bursae with a crescented signum at posterior part and a rounded signum at anterior part (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 118 )...............................................................
G. qujingella

42 . Ductus bursae covered with tiny spines at posterior part (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 91 ).....................
G. albilinealis

- Ductus bursae without spine (
Wang et al. 1988
: Fig. 124 )........................................ G. t a p h ro p h r a c t a
